result.execSummary:
The defendant David J. Welsh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Submit to DNA surcharge.  Undergo any counseling, treatment and evaluation per agent.   If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Defendant has 21 days credit if probation revoked.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David J. Welsh

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David J. Welsh in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea to Count 1.  Dismiss Count 2-3.  State gives joint recommendation.  Attorney Martinez agrees.  Attorney Martinez also goes through waiver for preliminary hearing on this case.  Defendant agrees and understands.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.
Count 1:
5 years Probation, Concurrent
DNA surcharge $250/sample
Undergo any counseling per agent.
AODA & treatment
$268.00 costs & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)
Paperwork handed in court.

Defendant David J. Welsh in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Martinez states matters are resolved but needs time to do plea/sent off of the 1pm calendar.  Court advises Atty Martinez to get date from his assistant w/in 30 days.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 13, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Pre-trial conference on January 30, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Return date on February 11, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant David J. Welsh in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Reset for PTc and RD.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 11:00 am.  Return date scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on December 26, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Return date on January 9, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant David J. Welsh by video from LEC with attorney Andrew I. Martinez appearing in person.  DE in custody.  Atty Tom Steinman also appears by video from the LEC.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and appearances.  Atty Martinez will argue bail on behalf of DE although he has not been appointed in this matter as of yet.  Defense waives reading of complaint.  State requests cash bond of $1,000.00.  Atty Martinez responds.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $1,000.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute sobriety at all times.  Atty Martinez addresses the prelims all set for today.  Requests they all be set to track for PTC and RD w/the new case.  Court so finds good cause for time limits to be waived in all pending matters so the cases may track.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 26, 2014 at 11:30 am.  Return date scheduled for January 9, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
